intro: Trigonachras papuensis, commonly known as the Papuan triangleleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
